Jupiter noun [S]
(PLANET)
Add to word list

the planet fifth in order of distance from the Sun, after Mars and before Saturn

Jupiter noun [S]
(GOD)
in Roman mythology (= ancient stories), the greatest of the gods, the god of the sky and the weather, who ruled over human beings and the other gods: In Roman times a temple to Jupiter stood here. Jupiter was the Roman god of thunder and storms. Compare
Zeus
More examplesFewer examplesThe site that was once used for pagan sacrifice in honor of the Roman god Jupiter.As the Roman world stopped believing in Jupiter and Venus, its gods become literary characters.The Romans gave to this planet the name Jupiter, the Roman king of the gods.
